samples.title: Tab App with Azure Backend
samples.shortDescription: A Hello World app of Microsoft Teams Tab app which has a backend service
samples.fullDescription: This is a Hello World app of Microsoft Teams Tab app which accomplishes very simple function like single-sign on. You can run this app locally or deploy it to Microsoft Azure. This app has a Tab frontend and a backend service using Azure Function.

samples.title: Contact Exporter using Graph Toolkit
samples.shortDescription: Contact Exporter app of Microsoft Teams Tab app.
samples.fullDescription: Contact Exporter app can export your teams contact info to Excel files, and it is using Microsoft Graph Toolkit as UI component. This app only has a Tab frontend.

samples.title: One Productivity Hub using Graph Toolkit
samples.shortDescription: Microsoft Teams tab with SSO to view calendar events, to-do tasks and file folders.
samples.fullDescription: One Productivity Hub sample shows you how to build a tab for viewing your calendar events, to-do tasks and files by using Microsoft Graph Toolkit components and TeamsFx provider. You can run this app locally or deploy it to Microsoft Azure.

samples.title: Bot App with SSO Enabled
samples.shortDescription: A Hello World app of Microsoft Teams Bot app with SSO
samples.fullDescription: This is an extended Hello World app of Microsoft Teams Bot app demonstrating how to integrate with Bot Framework SDK, TeamsFx SDK, and Graph SDK to implement SSO (Single Sign-On) feature that retrieves profile photos for currently signed-in users.

samples.title: Todo List with backend on Azure
samples.shortDescription: Todo List app with Azure Function backend and Azure SQL database
samples.fullDescription: Todo List provides an easy way to manage to-do items in Teams Client. This app helps enabling task collaboration and management for your team. The frontend is a React app and the backend is hosted on Azure. You will need an Azure subscription to run the app.

samples.title: Todo List with SPFx
samples.shortDescription: Todo List app hosting on SharePoint
samples.fullDescription: Todo List with SPFx is a Todo List for individuals to manage his/her personal to-do items. This app is hosted on Sharepoint. There is no requirements to deploy Azure resources.

samples.title: Share Now
samples.shortDescription: Knowledge sharing app contains a Tab and a Message extension
samples.fullDescription: Share Now promotes the exchange of information between colleagues by enabling users to share content within the Teams environment. Users engage the app to share items of interest, discover new shared content, set preferences, and bookmark favorites for later reading.

samples.title: My First Meeting App
samples.shortDescription: A template for apps using only in the context of a Teams meeting
samples.fullDescription: My first meeting app is a simple template to show how to build a tab app that can be installed and used in a meeting, in all of meeting lifecycles: pre-meeting chat, in-meeting, post-meeting chat. This sample contains tab as side panel, meeting chat tab, or meeting details tab. The template also includes simple codes to fetch meeting info and user profile.

samples.title: Todo List (Works in Teams, Outlook and Office)
samples.shortDescription: Todo List app that runs across Microsoft 365 including Teams, Outlook and Office
samples.fullDescription: Todo List app helps to manage personal to do items and also runs across Microsoft 365, including Teams, Outlook and Office. The frontend is a React app and the backend is an Azure Function. You can optionally deploy and host the app in Azure.

samples.title: NPM Search Connector
samples.shortDescription: Search and Share an NPM Package in Teams and Outlook (Web)
samples.fullDescription: NPM Search Connector is a Message Extension that runs across Microsoft 365 including Teams and Outlook (Web). It allows you to perform a quick search for a NPM package and insert package details into conversations for easy sharing. The front end is built with Adaptive Cards and the backend is an Azure Bot Service.

samples.title: Proactive Messaging
samples.shortDescription: Demonstrates how to send proactive messages to users.
samples.fullDescription: This is a sample which shows how to save user's conversation reference information to send proactive reminder message using Bots.

samples.title: Adaptive Card Notification
samples.shortDescription: Demonstrates how to send adaptive card notification to users.
samples.fullDescription: This is a sample which shows how to send notification with different adaptive cards using Bots.

samples.title: Incoming Webhook Notification
samples.shortDescription: Demonstrates how to send notification via Incoming Webhook.
samples.fullDescription: This is a sample which shows how to send notification via Incoming Webhook in Microsoft Teams channels.

samples.title: Graph Connector App
samples.shortDescription: Showcases how to build custom Graph Connector
samples.fullDescription: This sample app showcases how to build custom Graph Connector with Azure Functions and query data using Microsoft Graph Client and TeamsFx SDK.

samples.title: Stocks Update
samples.shortDescription: Keep up to date with the latest stock price in Microsoft Teams.
samples.fullDescription: This sample demonstrates how a Notification Bot can be used to call an external API using API Key authentication, on a pre-defined schedule of every 30 seconds, to obtain the latest stock information and render the results as an Adaptive Card.

samples.title: Org User Search Connector
samples.shortDescription: Query Org User with Message Extension SSO
samples.fullDescription: This is a simple search-based message extension app demonstrating how to integrate with Bot Framework SDK, TeamsFx SDK and Microsoft Graph API to implement a feature that queries organization's user with single sign on (SSO) capability.

samples.title: Minimal Teams Video App
samples.shortDescription: A minimal sample app with basic video processing capabilities
samples.fullDescription: A minimal sample app with basic video processing capabilities.

samples.title: Hello World Deeplinking Navigation Tab App
samples.shortDescription: This sample app shows, how to use new Teams SDK V2 capabilities to simplify the process of deeplink navigation across the hubs (on Teams, Outlook and Office).
samples.fullDescription: The Microsoft Teams JavaScript client SDK (TeamsJS) simplifies the process of deeplink navigation. For many scenarios, such as navigating to content and information within your tab or launching a chat dialog. It covers scenarios like, deeplinking from outside app/hub and navigating within app/hub.
